column4: in gnome when i try to open things under administration (e.g. network, users and groups), the window comes up but is blank... enentyually i kill it, or it says not responding... this doen't happn for everything, but it does for like 5 or 6 of the most important ones.  also, when i open gedit from terminal, it comes up but won't load any files... are these problems related?  how can i fix them?
all files?
or just files that require root access to read/write them?
sorry my food wasw ready.... well, i think i've only tried a coup,le of files with gedit... menu.lst is one
i'll try one that doesn't need root
you need to launch gedit with gksudo if you want to write files such as menu.lst. you should still be able to open it for reading normally, though.
ok yea i can open files that i have rw too... but when i use gksudo and enter my password, it says password not authenticated (it's correct tho) and when i try to use just sudo the gedit is blank
are you /sure/ you're entering the right password? correct case and all?
yeap
i'm sure
you don't have spaces in your password or anything like that, do you?
k now when i use gksudo, it's not asking for or denying the pass, but it's not loading gedit
are you doing anything differently?
nope, just that i've already entered/failed the password, and then used sudo
says "no process killed"
you didn't recently change your hostname, did you?
nope
i restored the ubuntu partition from an image, but this was happening before that
I also have problems loading windows for admin stuff like Network and Users and Groups and Services... not sure if that's ralated to this or not
lol
maybe there's something wrong with your GNOME. *shrug*
